programme.title: Miracle (2004)
programme.desc: Based on the true story of the 1980 Winter Olympics at Lake Placid, Miracle follows the journey of a hockey team that transcended its sport and united a nation with a new feeling of hope. Kurt Russell stars as hockey coach Herb Brooks, who assembles a U.S. team of underdogs and takes it up against the legendary juggernaut from the Soviet Union at the Olympic Games. No one thinks they can make it, but despite the odds Brooks leads the team to victory.

programme.title: Prancer (1989)
programme.desc: When nine year old Jessica finds a wounded reindeer near her home, she's sure it's one of Father Christmas's team. She knows he must be back with his master before Christmas Eve, and her faith in the magic of Christmas overcomes the cynicism of even the most hardened members of the community. This is a delightful tale that will bring a tear to your eye and a lump to your throat. A film full of the spirit of Christmas.

programme.title: The Nativity Story (2006)
programme.desc: (2006) Catherine Hardwicke's (Thirteen, Twilight) account of the birth of Christ stars Keisha Castle-Hughes as Mary and Oscar Isaac as Joseph. From the appearance of the angel Gabriel (Alexander Siddig), through Joseph's acceptance that she is indeed carrying the Son of God, to their trip to Bethlehem, the film is always respectful, with strong performances from the two leads who portray very real human emotions rather than those of saints. M,W,S.

programme.title: White Christmas (1954)
programme.desc: (1954) Bing Crosby, Danny Kaye and Rosemary Clooney star in this festive family favourite from prolific director Michael Curtiz. Bob Wallace (Crosby) and Phil Davis (Kaye) are friends who met while serving in World War II and have subsequently become a very successful song-and-dance team. They meet singing sisters Betty (Clooney) and Judy (Vera-Ellen) at a nightclub in Florida and, with a hint of romance in the air, together head off to rural Vermont, where the girls are booked to appear at a ski lodge. When they arrive, they discover that the place is run by the men's former commanding officer, Major General Waverly (Dean Jagger), who's in dire financial straits because unseasonably warm weather is keeping the snow at bay. So the four entertainers make plans to bail him out by staging a spectacular musical benefit show... Shot in Technicolor, the film was the first to be released in the high-resolution widescreen VistaVision format and, with its songs written by Irving Berlin, the movie was the year's top box-office hit.

programme.title: Miracle on 34th Street (1947)
programme.desc: Edmund Gwenn won a Best Supporting Actor Oscar for his portrayal of a department-store Santa Claus who runs afoul of the store's nasty in-house psychiatrist and is forced to go on trial to prove he's the real Kris Kringle. A Best Picture nominee, the film's director George Seaton won an Oscar for his script.

programme.title: Mr. Popper's Penguins (2011)
programme.desc: Jim Carrey stars in director Mark Waters' family comedy, loosely based on a classic children's book. Tom Popper is a New York property shark with a failed marriage and a strained relationship with his kids. Popper's own father was an explorer, usually absent while Tom was growing up. That could be reason for Tom's emotional disengagement, but his father certainly is the reason Tom ends up receiving a crate of six gentoo penguins - a bequest from the old man's deathbed. Manhattan isn't the obvious place in which to care for the birds, but not only does Popper quickly bond with his charges, his adventures with them also act as a springboard for possible reconciliation with his family - as well as ample opportunity for Carrey to ply his trademarked rubber-faced, flexed-limbed comedic turn. The penguins are real ones, their antics only enhanced rather than generated by CGI. And the only dark cloud on his horizon is the zoo's Nat Jones, who believes the creatures would be better off with him than in Popper's apartment. Also starring Ophelia Lovibond as Popper's assistant Pippi.

programme.title: The Polar Express (2004)
programme.desc: A doubting 8-year-old boy is whisked to the North Pole on a magical train for a meeting with Santa. Meanwhile, the train's conductor, along with the other young passengers, help turn the boy's crisis in faith into a wondrous journey of self-discovery.

programme.title: The Santa Clause 2 (2002)
programme.desc: Tim Allen returns as Santa, who discovers his run as Father Christmas will end if he doesn't find a Mrs Claus, in this sequel to "The Santa Clause".

programme.title: Samantha: An American Girl Holiday (2004)
programme.sub-title: An American Girl Holiday
programme.desc: In the early 1900s, Samantha (AnnaSophia Robb), a precocious orphan who lives with her wealthy grandmother (Mia Farrow), befriends a young servant girl and her sisters when they move in next door. Nellie: Kelsey Lewis. Gard: Jordan Bridges. Cornelia: Rebecca Mader.

programme.title: A Christmas Story 2 (2012)
programme.desc: This sequel to the holiday classic follows a teenage Ralphie's efforts to pay for damaging the car of his dreams, while his father continues to wage war throughout the suburbs.

programme.title: 'Twas the Night Before Christmas
programme.desc: A tuneful cartoon loosely adapted from Clement Moore's ballad. The story is set in a town whose newspaper has denounced Santa Claus as a charlatan. Voices...Narrator: Joel Grey. Albert: Tammy Grimes. Father Mouse: George Gobel. Mayor: John McGiver. Original songs are performed by Maury Laws and Jules Bass.

programme.title: Rudolph and Frosty's Christmas in July (1979)
programme.desc: Santa, Rudolph and Frosty are pitted against the sinister Winterbolt, who hopes to subdue Frosty, extinguish Rudolph's glowing nose and leave Santa lost in the fog forever. Voices... Santa: Mickey Rooney. Winterbolt: Paul Frees. Frosty: Jackie Vernon. Rudolph: Billie Richards. Lillie: Ethel Merman.

programme.title: Life and Adventures of Santa Claus
programme.desc: It may be Santa Claus' last yuletide sleigh ride unless the Great Ak can persuade fellow immortals to grant the merry man life everlasting. Ak tries to convince them by relating the story of Kris Kringle and how the Christmas-giving tradition began. Based on the book by L. Frank Baum.

programme.title: Leprechaun's Christmas Gold
programme.desc: Narrator Art Carney lends an Irish brogue to a tale of leprechaun gold and a wicked banshee. Faye: Peggy Cass. Dinty: Ken Jennings. Music: "Christmas in Killarney" and "Golden Gold of Ireland.".

programme.title: Nestor the Long-Eared Christmas Donkey
programme.desc: Animated tale about a donkey whose ears only bring him ridicule and unhappiness---until he helps Mary and Joseph arrive safely in Bethlehem. Voices by Roger Miller, Brenda Vaccaro and Paul Fries.

programme.title: Jack Frost
programme.desc: The winter sprite falls in love and yearns to become human in this musical tale featuring the voices of Buddy Hackett, Robert Morse, Larry Storch and Dave Garroway. Songs by Maury Laws and Jules Bass.

programme.title: Frosty's Winter Wonderland
programme.desc: Frosty the Snowman gets married in a winter wonderland. Voices...Andy Griffith, Shelley Winters, Jackie Vernon, Dennis Day. Songs include "Frosty the Snowman" and "Winter Wonderland.".

programme.title: 'Twas the Night Before Christmas

programme.title: Rudolph's Shiny New Year
programme.desc: Red Skelton narrates, while Frank Gorshin and Morey Amsterdam lend their voices to this tale about the reindeer on a mission for Santa. Johnny Marks' score includes the classic “Rudolph the Red-Nosed Reindeer.”.

programme.title: The Year Without a Santa Claus (1974)
programme.desc: Animated fantasy about a saddened Santa who decides not to make his annual ride. The score includes such holiday favorites as "Blue Christmas," along with six tunes composed by Maury Laws and Jules Bass.

programme.title: The Santa Clause 2 (2002)
programme.desc: Tim Allen returns as Santa, who discovers his run as Father Christmas will end if he doesn't find a Mrs Claus, in this sequel to "The Santa Clause".

programme.title: Elf (2003)
programme.desc: A human (Will Ferrell) who has been raised by elves leaves the North Pole to search for his gruff birth father (James Caan) in New York City. Winning holiday fantasy. Mary Steenburgen, Bob Newhart, Edward Asner, Zooey Deschanel. Jon Favreau directed.

programme.title: National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation (1989)
programme.desc: A family host their dysfunctional relatives for the holiday as the dad contends with spontaneously combusting Christmas lights and temperamental trees while anticipating the arrival of his annual bonus.

programme.sub-title: Picks Of The Litter

programme.title: Red Ape: Saving the Orangutan
programme.sub-title: Saving the Orangutan
programme.desc: A team fights to save the orangutans of Borneo.

programme.title: Amanda to the Rescue
programme.sub-title: Crates to Couches. Crates to Couches
programme.desc: Amanda goes undercover to take in three dogs rescued from puppy mills, including a sweet chihuahua that steals the heart of one of her crew members. Each dog has obstacles to overcome, and Amanda utilizes her pack dogs at home to help aid in their recovery.

programme.title: Amanda to the Rescue
programme.sub-title: Wildfire Puppy Rescue. Wildfire Puppy Rescue
programme.desc: Amanda rescues 3 dogs with special needs from the California wildfires, including a very pregnant Chihuahua that could give birth at any moment. With the help of her family, she rehabilitates them at her at-home rescue and finds them their forever homes.

programme.title: Amanda to the Rescue
programme.sub-title: Puppy Overload. Puppy Overload
programme.desc: A new mama Chihuahua and her 8 puppies are finally ready to go to their forever homes. With the help of a volunteer, Amanda takes "Splat," a special needs bulldog puppy with swimmers syndrome, into her care and does everything she can to save her.

programme.title: Dodo Heroes
programme.sub-title: Pen and the Dogs of War. Pen and the Dogs of War
programme.desc: British Marine Pen Farthing runs Afghanistan's only official animal sanctuary. He's determined to reunite six dogs with the solider who saved them in Texas.

programme.title: Dodo Heroes
programme.desc: Chimp expert Estelle Raballand has formed an incredible bond with Ponso, a chimp who lives alone on an island and has been dubbed the loneliest chimp in the world. She's determined to find him a companion and thinks she has found the perfect match.

programme.title: Dodo Heroes
programme.sub-title: Derrick's Elephant Challenge. Derrick's Elephant Challenge
programme.desc: Derrick Campana specializes in designing prosthetics and orthotic braces for animals, and will try to fit Jabu, an elephant in Botswana with a life-threatening injury, with the world's first elephant orthotic leg brace in hopes that it will save its life.

programme.title: Dodo Heroes
programme.sub-title: Jan and Tim's Greatest Show on Earth. Jan and Tim's Greatest Show on Earth
programme.desc: Animal Defenders International (ADI) is led by Jan Creamer and Tim Phillips, and has already helped ban the animal circus industry in over 40 countries. When their organization arrives in Peru, they embark on their biggest animal rescue challenge yet.

programme.title: Dodo Heroes
programme.sub-title: Izzy the Koala Whisperer. Izzy the Koala Whisperer
programme.desc: Ali Bee, her husband Tim, and daughter Izzy spend their time rescuing and rehabilitating koalas in their home in Australia. Crikey the koala was a baby that was found alone and very sick. Now, it's time for the family to release him into the wild.

programme.title: Dodo Heroes
programme.sub-title: Katherine's Elephant Eden
programme.desc: Katherine and her children run an elephant sanctuary that rescues and rehabilitates elephants from Thailand's tourism and logging industries before rewilding them. Now she wants to rescue an older elephant, Pang Fai, and release her from chains forever.

programme.title: The Steve Irwin Story
programme.desc: A profile of Steve Irwin (1962-2006), aka the Crocodile Hunter, whose impact far exceeded his hit series. Chronicling his childhood to his time as a global icon, those who knew him best reflect on the remarkable life of the man, father, husband and wildlife conservationist.

programme.title: The Crocodile Hunter
programme.desc: Host Steve Irwin investigates the remote islands of Indonesia to observe the huge Komodo dragon, the largest lizard in the world.

programme.title: The Crocodile Hunter
programme.desc: Host Steve Irwin joins the Australian Zoo team and World Society for the Protection of Animals on a wildlife rescue mission to remove crocodiles from a zoo in war-torn East Timor.

programme.title: The Crocodile Hunter
programme.desc: With exclusive commentary from Terri Irwin and Wes Mannion, Steve and Wes find themselves island hopping around Indonesia, and have chance encounters with lizards, venomous snakes and a group of playful monkeys.

programme.title: The Crocodile Hunter
programme.desc: With exclusive commentary from Terri Irwin and Wes Mannion, Steve Irwin explores Madagascar's rugged terrain and underground rivers, meeting the chameleons, snakes and crocodiles that roam the island nation's wilds.

programme.title: The Crocodile Hunter
programme.desc: Eleven crocodiles must be relocated at the zoo, so Steve develops a new method to capture them. Also: a white crocodile is introduced at the zoo and proves to be aggressive towards a female.

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.sub-title: Moving Day. Moving Day
programme.desc: A male sea lion is in a rut, so the staff must move the younger ones before he becomes territorial; a flamingo has a broken ankle; feeding a rock python presents a challenge.

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.sub-title: Handle With Care. Handle With Care
programme.desc: A tomistoma, or freshwater crocodile, stops laying eggs; a baby antelope must be rescued when it's not getting the necessary care from its mother; and Mert the goose takes a field trip.

programme.sub-title: Love Shack. Love Shack
programme.desc: An elaborate hut is built for a pair of kiwis to breed; a king cobra arrives at the zoo, but it's not easy training it to move from the exhibit to a holding pen.

programme.title: Tanked
programme.sub-title: Dining with the Fishes. Dining with the Fishes
programme.desc: A table tank is built when Brett and Wayde team up with a dinnerware company for a trade show in Las Vegas; a seafood restaurant wants an aquarium that looks like a crab boat.

programme.title: Tanked
programme.sub-title: Wilmer's Tank-errama. Wilmer's Tank-errama
programme.desc: Best friends and constant rivals Wayde King and Brett Raymer are back and continuing to grow America's largest aquarium manufacturing company, Acrylic Tank Manufacturing, ATM.

programme.title: Tanked
programme.sub-title: Tanked for the Holidays. Tanked for the Holidays
programme.desc: A holiday-theme cylinder tank is built for a real-estate company in Atlanta; a snow-globe aquarium is requested by the mayor of Henderson, Nev., for the city's annual WinterFest celebration. Meanwhile, Heather and Agnes prepare for the ATM holiday party.

programme.title: Tanked
programme.sub-title: Tanked Again for the Holidays. Tanked Again for the Holidays
programme.desc: An Irish bar in Florida requests an aquarium with a pub theme; a jerky store in Las Vegas wants a butcher-block tank. Meanwhile, Brett goes overboard on his holiday decorations.

programme.title: Tanked
programme.sub-title: Holiday Madness. Holiday Madness
programme.desc: Wayde and Brett compete for bragging rights to see who can build the baddest tank, and the contest is judged by "Jackass" cocreator Jeff Tremaine.

programme.title: Tanked
programme.sub-title: We Fish You a Merry Christmas. We Fish You a Merry Christmas
programme.desc: Australian singer Alli Simpson helps Wayde and Brett spread holiday cheer when they make a surprise aquarium donation to Hurley Children's Hospital in Flint, Mich.

programme.title: Tanked
programme.sub-title: Rock N' Roll Eruption! Rock N' Roll Eruption!
programme.desc: An eight-piece drum-kit tank—that's playable—is built for a client in Florida; a Hawaiian restaurant in Las Vegas wants an aquarium with a volcano that smokes and spews lava.

programme.desc: The first few months of three litters of puppies, including pugs, mini-Australian shepherds and Rottweilers, are observed.

programme.desc: Jack Black stars in Richard Linklater's comedy as Dewey Finn, a slacker rock musician who dreams of the big time. Bluffing his way into a job as a supply teacher at an expensive private school, he discovers his class have some musical ability. And if he can harness it to the world of rock and enter them in a Battle of the Bands contest, he will have found a purpose. Black's breakthrough role is supported by the smart acting of the ensemble cast of kids, led by Miranda Cosgrove, and Joan Cusack as the school's head teacher.

programme.desc: A competing salesman (Timothy Olyphant) begins stealing Dunder Mifflin's clients. To unearth the pilferer's sales secrets, Michael sets up a sting with Jim and Dwight. Meanwhile, Andy is inspired to start a band after discovering that his college pal has forged a successful music career.

programme.title: The Office
programme.sub-title: Costume Contest. Costume Contest
programme.desc: The staffers turn overly competitive when they scare up a Halloween costume contest. Meanwhile, Darryl gives an idea to corporate himself, passing over a fuming Michael. And Pam corners Danny (Timothy Olyphant) about their dating history.

programme.title: The Office
programme.sub-title: Christening. Christening
programme.desc: Michael invites all the staffers to celebrate the christening of Jim and Pam's baby.

programme.title: The Office
programme.sub-title: Viewing Party. Viewing Party
programme.desc: Erin and Gabe host a "Glee" viewing party for the gang at Gabe's house. Meanwhile, Michael lacks any semblance of glee when the staffers refer to Gabe as his boss. As for Andy, his jealousy over Gabe and Erin's relationship grows and grows.

programme.title: The Office
programme.sub-title: WUPHF.com. WUPHF.com
programme.desc: Michael puts on the charm by trying to attract investors to Ryan's fledgling Internet company. Meanwhile, Dwight celebrates Thanksgiving and his childhood by organizing a hay festival in the office parking lot; and a newly implemented policy prevents Jim from earning commission. Kathy Bates and Jack Coleman guest star.

programme.title: The Office
programme.sub-title: China. China
programme.desc: Michael reads about China's growth as a global power, so he sets out to stop the country from taking over the U.S. Meanwhile, Dwight's building standards irritate the staffers, and Pam threatens to move the branch to a new building.

programme.title: The Office
programme.sub-title: Classy Christmas, Part 1. Classy Christmas, Part 1
programme.desc: Part 1 of 2. It's a Holly jolly Christmas for Michael when his office nemesis, Toby, takes a leave of absence. This opens the door for one Holly Flax (Amy Ryan), who returns to Scranton to cover for Toby. Meanwhile, Pam is pushed into throwing two holiday parties when Michael insists they have one for Holly's return; and Jim and Dwight square off in a snowball fight.

programme.title: The Office
programme.sub-title: Classy Christmas, Part 2. Classy Christmas, Part 2
programme.desc: Conclusion. Holly returns to fill in as the HR rep when Toby takes a leave of absence; Pam is pushed into throwing two holiday parties; Jim and Dwight square off in a snowball fight.

programme.title: The Office
programme.sub-title: Ultimatum. Ultimatum
programme.desc: Michael anxiously awaits news from Holly about the status of her romance. Meanwhile, the staffers share their New Year's resolutions; and Andy, Dwight and Darryl try to woo women on their lunch break.

programme.title: The Office
programme.sub-title: The Seminar. The Seminar
programme.desc: When Andy falls into a sales slump, he desperately hosts a small business seminar featuring special guests. Before long, the event turns into an opportunity for Michael and Holly (Amy Ryan) to showcase their improv-comedy flair (or lack thereof). Elsewhere, Erin and Gabe compete in a game of Scrabble.

programme.title: The Office
programme.sub-title: The Search. The Search
programme.desc: When Jim receives an emergency call, he's forced to leave Michael in a petrol station bathroom. Michael then vanishes, prompting Holly, Erin and Dwight to embark on an odd odyssey to find him. Elsewhere, Pam's art inspires a captioning challenge, but the office contest agitates Gabe.

programme.title: The Office
programme.sub-title: PDA. PDA
programme.desc: Michael's relationship with Holly (Amy Ryan) flowers on Valentine's Day, but their public displays of affection disturb and perturb the others. Elsewhere, troubles bubble over for Jim and Pam following a champagne lunch; and Gabe sets up a romantic treasure hunt for Erin.

programme.title: Hall Pass (2011)
programme.desc: Rick and Fred are best friends who have a lot in common, including the fact that they have each been married for many years. But when the two men begin to show signs of restlessness at home, their wives take a bold approach to revitalizing their individual marriages: granting them a 'hall pass', one week of freedom to do whatever they want' no questions asked. At first, it sounds like a dream come true for Rick and Fred. But it isn't long before they discover that their expectations of the single life 'and themselves' are completely, and hilariously, out of sync with reality.

programme.title: Talladega Nights: The Ballad of Ricky Bobby (2006)
programme.sub-title: The Ballad of Ricky Bobby
programme.desc: Will Ferrell is a gas in this fast-paced comic vehicle about the rise and fall and rise again of a NASCAR driver.

programme.title: Dirty Grandpa (2016)
programme.desc: A straight-laced lawyer and his horndog grandfather go on a road trip to Daytona Beach for spring break. Along the way, the elderly man prods his grandson to let loose, and tries to convince him that he shouldn't get married to his controlling fiancée.

programme.title: South Park
programme.sub-title: Butterballs. Butterballs <span >
programme.desc: Stan organizes an antibullying video when Butters is tormented by an unlikely predator.

programme.title: South Park
programme.sub-title: The Poor Kid. The Poor Kid <span >
programme.desc: In the 15th-season finale, the arrest of Kenny's parents sends him and his two siblings into the foster-care system, but the situation creates a dilemma for Cartman, who is left without a target to mock for being the poorest kid in school.

programme.title: South Park
programme.sub-title: Wieners Out. Wieners Out <span >

programme.title: South Park
programme.sub-title: Raisins. Raisins <span >

programme.title: Bad Santa (2003)
programme.desc: A hilariously criminal Santa finds a measure of holiday redemption when he befriends a troubled kid. The traditional Christmas tale will never be the same after this cleverly twisted, merrily irreverent story of a Santa so bad that he's funny. Billy Bob Thornton stars (in a Golden Globe-nominated role) as Willie T. Stokes, a washed-up, wisecracking department store Santa who is only in the business for the criminal opportunities. Every Christmas Eve this Santa and his ingenious Elf' Willie's midget partner-in-crime Marcus (Tony Cox), crack the store safe and make off with their own holiday stash. But this year Santa and his Elf find their annual heist endangered by a pesky store manager (John Ritter), a savvy mall detective (Bernie Mac), a sexy Santa fan (Lauren Graham) and an 8-year-old misfit (Brett Kelly) who decides to believe that Willie: intoxicated, acid-tongued and felonious as he is, is the real Santa.

Meanwhile, Roberta is hired as a Christmas elf at a department store, but her chauvinistic employer requires her and Santa's other female helpers to wear sexy costumes.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch

programme.desc: Host Josh Gates helps scientists who want to bring the woolly mammoth back to life. First, he visits the Korean biotech lab driving the project. Then, he joins an excavation of ancient bones in a working Canadian gold mine. Finally, he descends into a vast sinkhole in Siberia to unearth frozen DNA.

programme.title: Expedition Unknown
programme.sub-title: Journey to the Ice Age. Journey to the Ice Age
programme.desc: Josh searches for a viable sample of mammoth DNA. Included: He retrieves bone samples from the massive Batagay crater; and journeys far upriver to a site in the lawless Siberian wilderness, where tusk hunters carve out troves of bones from the permafrost. Also: The specimens are treated and tested in a lab; and finally, Josh learns the chances of the woolly mammoth walking again.

programme.desc: During a frantic holiday season, the world's wealthiest kid (David Gallagher) gets transported to an alternate universe where he is penniless and anonymous---and where he realizes just how wonderful life is. programme.title: Toy Story That Time Forgot
programme.desc: Woody and friends are back in this brand new TV special. This time the gang have to rely on Trixie the Triceratops to save them from some dangerously delusional toys.

programme.title: Santa Claus Is Comin' to Town
programme.desc: Fred Astaire and Mickey Rooney are among those who lend their voices to this holiday tale, which explains the legend of Santa Claus and how he began delivering toys to children on Christmas Eve. As a young man, he tries to deliver toys to the kids of Sombertown, but is met with opposition by the bitter Burgermeister Meisterburger, a mayor who hates toys and deems them “illegal, immoral, unlawful.” Other voices include Keenan Wynn, Joan Gardner, Paul Frees.

programme.title: The Nightmare Before Christmas (1993)
programme.desc: Tim Burton's stop-motion animated feature finds Pumpkin King Jack Skellington thinking the grass is greener over in Santa Claus's holiday. He marshalls all his goblins and ghouls to take over Christmas, but alas--poor Jack belongs to Halloween. An amazing visual and musical feast that should be seen at least twice to catch all the kinks and quirks in the nooks and crannies.

programme.title: Christmas With the Kranks (2004)
programme.desc: Since their daughter won't be around at Christmas, Luther and Nora Krank decide to boycott the festivities and save for a cruise. But Vic and the rest of their neighbours refuse to allow such Scrooge-like behaviour in their suburb. Comedy based on John Grisham's novel.

programme.title: The Santa Clause (1994)
programme.desc: Home Improvement star Tim Allen makes his motion picture debut in this touching story of Scott Calvin, a father having to compete for his son's affections with a new stepfather. A bizarre twist of fate magically transforms him into Santa Claus, and when the . real. Santa falls off the roof on Christmas Eve, Scott agrees to stand-in temporarily... A positive feast of festive fun, mirth and merriment with one of the biggest comedy talents of our time.

programme.title: The Santa Clause 3: The Escape Clause (2006)
programme.sub-title: The Escape Clause
programme.desc: The third instalment of the popular holiday series picks up with Everyman-turned-Santa-Claus Scott Calvin just days before Christmas. Not only is toy production behind schedule, but another special delivery is on its way: Scott's wife, Carol/Mrs. Claus is pregnant. To add to the pressure, Carol's parents are coming for a visit, prompting an emergency make-over for Santa's Village to protect Scott's true identity...

programme.title: Dr. Seuss' How the Grinch Stole Christmas (2000)
programme.desc: The Grinch, a foul-tempered green and hairy creature who lives on Mount Crumpit, hates Christmas almost as much as he hates the residents of Whoville, the town at the bottom of his mountain. One night he decides to steal Christmas away from the Whos by taking all their decorations, presents and Christmassy things. However, he soon learns a valuable lesson about the true spirit of the festive season. An adaptation of the 'How The Grinch Stole Christmas' by Dr. Seuss.

programme.title: The 700 Club
programme.desc: A religious-themed newsmagazine, one of TV's longest-running programs. On the air since 1966, it launched nationally in '72, before becoming the flagship of the Christian Broadcast Network in 1977. It mixes news---from a religious perspective---with inspirational interviews with celebrities, along with Bible readings and entertainment. Conservative icon (and 1988 presidential candidate) Pat Robertson founded the hugely popular program from a 1963 fund-raising pledge effort on UHF TV in Virginia.

programme.title: Forrest Gump (1994)
programme.desc: Two-time Academy Award winner Tom Hanks stars alongside Sally Field and Robin Wright in this multi-Oscar winning blockbuster. The story follows the life of low I.Q. Forrest Gump and his meeting with the love of his life Jenny Curran. The film chronicles his accidental experiences with some of the most important people and events in America from the late 1950s through the 1970s including a meeting with Elvis Presley, JFK, Lyndon Johnson, Richard Nixon, fighting in Vietnam, etc. The problem is, he's too stupid to realize the significance of his actions. Forrest becomes representative of the baby boomer generation having walked through life blindly. Starring Tom Hanks, Sally Field and Robin Wright.

programme.title: The Goonies (1985)
programme.desc: Mikey and Brandon Walsh are two brothers whose family is preparing to move due to a new development that is sure to be started unless enough money is raised. But when Mikey stumbles on a treasure map, he, his brother, and some friends set out on a quest to find out the riches in hope to save their homes. The entrance to a cavern is found, but it is located underneath the house of the Fratelli family, a treacherous band of thieves.

programme.title: Dirty Dancing (1987)
programme.desc: The late Hollywood heartthrob Patrick Swayze and Golden Globe nominee Jennifer Grey team up as dirty dance partners in this Oscar winning romantic classic. A teenage girl learns about love, adult responsibility, and how to do The Dirty Boogie. A teenage girl learns about love, adult responsibility, and how to do The Dirty Boogie in this romantic drama. In 1963, "Baby" Houseman (Jennifer Grey) is a 17-year-old spending the summer with her family at a resort hotel in the Catskills; she plans on being in the Peace Corps next summer, so this is expected to be her last summer as a carefree adolescent. Baby doesn't get along with her older sister, Lisa (Jane Brucker), and she's bored to tears by most of the older guests at the resort. However, one night Baby hears what sounds like a party going on in the employee's dormitory, and she pokes her head in to discover most of the hotel staff enjoying the sort of close dancing that would get you kicked out of the senior prom in no time flat. Baby is particularly struck by handsome Johnny Castle (Patrick Swayze), a dancer in the resort's floor show, and falls head over heels in love, wanting to be near him. Dirty Dancing was a surprise box-office hit, and the soundtrack album was an even bigger success, spawning several hit singles. Starring Patrick Swayze, Jennifer Grey & Jane Brucker.

programme.title: While You Were Sleeping (1995)

programme.title: Maid in Manhattan (2002)
programme.desc: Jennifer Lopez and Ralph Fiennes star in this romcom, director Wayne Wang's modern-day take on the Cinderella folk tale. Single parent Marisa Ventura works in an upmarket New York hotel where a swanky event is taking place. When she's instructed by one of the moneyed guests to return an expensive freebie dress, Marisa can't help but try the unwanted garment on. And that's when she bumps into rising politico Christopher Marshall, who is clearly smitten. From the context of their meeting, he naturally assumes that she's a socialite - will he still feel the same attraction for her if he discovers that she is, in fact, a maid?

programme.title: Pretty in Pink (1986)
programme.desc: Molly Ringwald is an underprivileged Cinderella choosing between two prom princes: a charming preppy and a disarming buddy.

programme.title: Monster-in-Law (2005)
programme.desc: Jane Fonda stars as a bridegroom's psychotic mother, who tries to sabotage her son's relationship with his lovely bride-to-be.

programme.title: The Notebook (2004)
programme.desc: Allie Hamilton (Rachel McAdams) meets Noah Calhoun (Ryan Gosling) at a fair, while on vacation with his family in a coastal city. Just one look tells Noah that they are predestined to be together, but they are kept apart by the circumstances, both social (she is rich he is a factory worker) and historical (the Second World War). She returns years later, though now engaged to some one else. At the same time, the turbulent story is revived by a woman in an old people's home (Gena Rowlands), as a man reads to her from an old notebook….

programme.title: White Christmas (1954)
programme.desc: (1954) Bing Crosby, Danny Kaye and Rosemary Clooney star in this festive family favourite from prolific director Michael Curtiz. Bob Wallace (Crosby) and Phil Davis (Kaye) are friends who met while serving in World War II and have subsequently become a very successful song-and-dance team. They meet singing sisters Betty (Clooney) and Judy (Vera-Ellen) at a nightclub in Florida and, with a hint of romance in the air, together head off to rural Vermont, where the girls are booked to appear at a ski lodge. When they arrive, they discover that the place is run by the men's former commanding officer, Major General Waverly (Dean Jagger), who's in dire financial straits because unseasonably warm weather is keeping the snow at bay. So the four entertainers make plans to bail him out by staging a spectacular musical benefit show... Shot in Technicolor, the film was the first to be released in the high-resolution widescreen VistaVision format and, with its songs written by Irving Berlin, the movie was the year's top box-office hit.

programme.title: Invasion of the Christmas Lights
programme.desc: This is a Christmas special for the schedule with a twist. Mix X-treme Christmas obsession with neighbours from Hell and you get Invasion Of The Christmas Lights! Christmas is a time for giving and these X-treme characters believe they are giving a whole load of love and joy to their families, neighbours and community. They don't realise they are giving some of their neighbours a nightmare from Hell! We follow our Christmas enthusiasts as they prepare for their biggest and best Christmas yet! Hundreds and thousands of dollars are spent on their Christmas displays each year as they transform their homes into the biggest Christmas display EVER seen in their street, their towns, their country! They are super competitive and start working from the 1st January each year. For some it means composing music and a digital system their lights move to the beat of and for others miles more extension cords and hundreds of electrical sockets are designed around Disney type features. There is one thing they all have in common, they are OBSESSED.

programme.title: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince (2009)
programme.desc: Harry Potter returns to Hogwarts for his sixth year -- to face a growing danger that may be more than a match for his strengthening powers as a wizard. While Death Eaters emboldened by the return of Lord Voldemort wreak havoc in both the Muggle and Wizarding worlds, Harry suspects new dangers lie within Hogwarts. Dumbledore, racing to prepare Harry for a final battle that he knows is fast approaching, brings him on a perilous mission to find the key to unlock Voldemort's defenses. Meanwhile, the students are under attack from a different adversary as teenage hormones rage: Harry's friendship with Ginny Weasley grows into something deeper Lavender Brown lavishes her affections on Ron Hermione simmers with jealousy¿ and a box of love potion-laced chocolates ends up in the wrong hands.

Harry's arch-enemy has hidden parts of his soul in secret locations and the trio must find and destroy them to stop him remaining immortal, but as the mission progresses dark forces look set to throw them off course.

programme.sub-title: Lake Life. Lake Life
programme.desc: In the ninth-season opener, the family go on a houseboat vacation at Jay's behest. Meanwhile, Mitchell runs into an old flame; Cam is forced to stay out of the sun; and Phil and Claire try out some adventurous excursions.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.sub-title: The Long Goodbye. The Long Goodbye
programme.desc: Phil and Claire visit Alex at college and realize how self-sufficient she is. Meanwhile, Manny want to avoid a long, tearful goodbye after Gloria and Jay move him into his college dorm; and Mitch may have accidentally accelerated a planned renovation.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.sub-title: Catch of the Day. Catch of the Day
programme.desc: Phil thinks he's going to have a day of bad luck after he doesn't complete his daily superstition, but Claire has no time for his silly notion. Meanwhile, Mitch believes Cam is undermining him during their kitchen renovation.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.sub-title: Sex, Lies & Kickball. Sex, Lies & Kickball
programme.desc: Jay's pal Shorty returns from Costa Rica and stays at Jay's house so they can reconnect, but he spends more time with Gloria than with Jay. Meanwhile, Alex wants to shed her good-girl image and prove to Claire that she's in a sexual relationship with Ben.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.sub-title: Ten Years Later. Ten Years Later
programme.desc: Claire wants to throw a party for Jay's wedding anniversary to atone for her mood at his nuptials. As part of the festivities, Phil plans to perform a magic trick featuring Gloria appearing out of thin air in her wedding dress, which may no longer fit.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.sub-title: Brushes With Celebrity. Brushes With Celebrity
programme.desc: The Pritchett-Dunphy-Tucker clan recount their biggest celebrity encounters, including Phil showing a house to his musical hero despite the intense pain radiating from a very inconvenient part of his body. Also: Jay's day at jury duty takes an unexpected turn when he gets to serve it alongside one of America's biggest football icons; and Manny's encounter with his favorite playwright and a celebrated actor and comedian don't go as expected.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.sub-title: Tough Love. Tough Love
programme.desc: After leaving his real estate firm to strike out on his own, Phil decides a solo camping trip in the wild will be just what he needs to boost his confidence. Meanwhile, Mitchell's plan to teach Cam a lesson in gullibility and Lily a lesson in responsibility backfires.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.sub-title: No Small Feet. No Small Feet
programme.desc: When Claire lands a big opportunity for Pritchett's Closets, Jay expects a little validation for his contribution; and Pam's ex-boyfriend Bo shows up and Mitchell sees this as the perfect opportunity to get Pam out of the house. Meanwhile, Luke and Alex stumble upon a successful online business that finally gets them on their feet.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.sub-title: He Said, She Shed. He Said, She Shed
programme.desc: Claire wants a She Shed in her backyard, but her request is denied by the homeowners association, and only Luke and Phil know the real reason why. Meanwhile, Pameron lets Cam in on a family secret, and this forces Cam to visit Mitch's therapist.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.sub-title: Dear Beloved Family. Dear Beloved Family
programme.desc: Gloria has to rush Phil to the hospital for an emergency surgery after he experiences some intense stomach pains and rallies the entire family to be by his side.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.sub-title: In Your Head. In Your Head
programme.desc: When Luke goes missing after a night out in a sketchy neighborhood, Manny, Phil and Gloria team up to track him down. Meanwhile, Haley is desperate to land an interview with the creator of a popular lifestyle website and interrupts Alex during one of her college classes. Alex's professor, Arvin Fennerman, then proceeds to try and give Haley a piece of his mind.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.sub-title: Spanks for the Memories. Spanks for the Memories
programme.desc: When Jay overhears Gloria on the phone talking about spanking, he assumes she is frustrated in the bedroom. When he attempts to light the spark again by giving her exactly what she wants, he realizes he might have made a mistake. Meanwhile, now that Mitchell has an amazing new job, he and Cam throw a party to rub it in Cam's friends' faces so they can no longer give him "the look of pity.".

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.sub-title: Wine Weekend. Wine Weekend
programme.desc: The family goes on a wine-tasting trip and stays in Haley's new boss' country house where the only rule is: Don't touch the tiara. Meanwhile, Gloria and Mitch are invited to a party at Oprah's house but can't bring anyone else.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.sub-title: Royal Visit. Royal Visit
programme.desc: Haley's brilliant astrophysicist boyfriend comes to meet the family, setting Claire and Phil off in a competition about which one of them is smarter, making Alex feel self-conscious about her dim but handsome firefighter boyfriend, Bill. Mitch and Cam go on a yoga retreat, but when Cam finds out his dream team, the Kansas City Royals, is having spring training next door, he can't resist sneaking out.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.sub-title: CHiPs and Salsa. CHiPs and Salsa
programme.desc: When Haley hears that her loopy boss is looking for a product with the magical properties of peppers, she tries to gain favor by convincing Gloria to sell her salsa to NERP; and Mitchell gets Cam the police ride-along he's always dreamed of.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.sub-title: Mother! Mother!
programme.desc: When Dede drops in unexpectedly, Mitchell and Cam come to a realization about her effect on their lives; Phil, Luke, Alex and Haley all have different bad news to break to Claire and compete about when to do it, the tiny window of time after her monthly spa day when she's her most relaxed.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.sub-title: The Escape. The Escape
programme.desc: Haley meets Arvin's parents but when things don't go as planned, fate leads to an unexpected reunion with all of her ex-boyfriends. Meanwhile, the family seizes on a nursing home visit with Jay's mean sister, Becky, to settle old scores. But as Jay, Claire and Mitchell compete for her time, Phil, Cam and Gloria end up getting trapped in the home's basement with no way out.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.sub-title: Clash of Swords. Clash of Swords
programme.desc: In the Season 9 finale, Mitchell sneaks out to "Hero-Con" with fanboy Phil, dressed as their favorite characters from the show "Clash of Swords." It's great until Phil commits the ultimate fan faux pas. In a clash of another kind, Gloria's dinosaur party for Joe is ruined when her nemesis, Dr. Donna Duncan, upstages her with a far bigger and better party right next door.

programme.title: The Fast and the Furious (2001)
programme.desc: Vin Diesel (Triple X) is Dominic Toretto, leader of a gang accused of stealing over a million dollars in electronic equipment. Packed with adrenaline, he makes a living transforming regular cars into powerful racing cars. With a stronghold on the streets of Los Angeles, nothing seems to stop him. Until a new King of Speed appears -undercover police officer Brian O'Conner, sent by the FBI to infiltrate the gang and find out who is responsible for the robberies. Quick and tough, Brian has enough experience and determination to become the winner on the roads. As he gains Dominic's confidence, he has everything to solve the case. In the process they become friends and Brian falls in love with Dominic's sister, Mia.
